intro: Hyptis viminea, commonly known as the silverleaf hyptis, is a flowering plant native to the warm regions of the Americas. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, tubular flowers are usually white or pale blue and bloom in clusters during the summer months. Hyptis viminea is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage.
